result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles Body Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Body Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell appeared by video for Charles Body Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective Shannon Orvis.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. 
Case is adjourned to 11-7-22 at 8:30 am for an arraignment by zoom.
Arraignment scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 095180,
Payable Number: 1037056,
Receipt Number: 22RP040076,
Amount: $20.00

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for LEVEL 4 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DMC. 
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Charles Body Jr in court.  Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell in court for Charles Body Jr. Student Intern Abigail Doweiko in court under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter by telephone for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/2/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 9-2-2022 @1p
